Package harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib

Class TGame

java.lang.Object
harrygpotter.tombola.tombolalib.TGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class TGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
TombolaGame class is a funny piece of code, where a Tombola game match can be simulated, monitored, controlled and analyzed. I like it very much! It is another piece of magic for me!
Since:
1.8
Version:
1.1
Author:
Harry G. Potter harry.g.potter@gmail.com
See Also:
TAward, TAwardList, Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    TGame​(java.lang.String gameID)
    Unique constructor for TGame object. All you need to specify is a name that will help to identify this specific game. A brand new TGame object is in 'Initializing' state and all components needed to start a game MUST be created apart and specified using respective setter methods: a sacchetto, a list of gaming cards, a tabellone, a logger.

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean addCardToTheGame​(TCard newCard)  
    TGameResultCode extractNumber()
    This method acts just like extractNumber(int) but does not require the extracted number as external input, providing automatically to extract a random number that has not already been extracted before.

    You can consider this method as the "prince" of all TGame methods! It executes all the logic and controls to simulate and manage the consequences of the extraction of a number during a tombola game. It requires as an external input the number to be extracted (of course, it must be a valid number that has not been already extracted before) and checks all cards participating to the game against the available awards to verify if...
    TAwardList getAwardList()
    Return the complete list of award objects currently used by this game.
    int[][] getConflictVector()
    Used to do statistical analysis on tombola matches.
    long getElapsedTime()
    Return the elapsed time, in milliseconds, since the beginning of this tombola game.  If the game hasn't already been started, this method raise a runtime exception. If the game has already finished, this method return the duration of the game.
    int getExtractionCount()
    Return the counter for extracted tombola number during the game.
    TAward getFirstAwardToResolve()
    When, during the tombola game, an award is contended by more than one card, that is, the game is paused in status "RESOLVING", this method returns the first award object within the ordered award list that have many contending cards.
    long getGameEndTS()
    Return the timestamp (a long value indicating the standard 'system time') of the ending moment of the game.

    Return the timestamp (a long value indicating the standard 'system time') of the beginning of the game.

    Return the card list object containing all the cards participating to the game.

    Return true is jolly numbers are considered 'special' and highlighted in log messages during the game, false is they are ignored, that is considered as any other normal number on cards.

    int[][] getWinVector()  
    void letBillBoardPlay()  
    TGameResultCode resolveCandidates​(int winnerPos)
    This method is a syntactic sugar method and acts just like resolveCandidates(int[]), but allows to specify just a single, unique winner card for the first award that is in "CONTENDING" status. See the cited companion method for further details.
    TGameResultCode resolveCandidates​(int[] winnerIndexes)
    When, after the extraction of a number, more than one card reach the score to be appointed to an available award, the game "pauses", enters the "RESOLVING" status and requires that someone, from the external, make a choice and resolves the conflicts. This method helps to manage this very common situation, letting the user to adopt whatever criteria she/he wants to take the choice and thus communicating it to the TGame object by means of this method.
    TGameResultCode rollback()
    This method, as you can imagine, allows the rollback of the last extracted number during a tombola game. Perhaps it requires to be checked, tested and fixed a bit...
    void setAwardList​(TAwardList awards)
    Set the (previously prepared, see TAwardList) list of awards that will be available during the game. As usual, even this setter method can be invoked only during the INITIALIZING status of the tombola game object.
    void setGamingCards​(TCardList cardList)
    Set the list containing all the cards that will be used during the tombola game.
    void setJollyOn​(boolean useJolly)
    Set the flag indicating is jolly numbers configured on cards must be considered when playing the game.
    void setLogger​(ILogger logger)
    Set the logger object that will be used during the game to spool all relevant messages regarding the status of the match.
    void setSacchetto​(TSacchetto sacchetto)
    Set the sacchetto object (that is, the ballot box) to be used during the tombola game.  This method must be invoked only when the TGame object is in 'Initializing' status, that is before a match has been started (the first number has been extracted). Besides, the sacchetto object must be fresh new and contains all 90 numbers.

    • TGame

      public TGame​(java.lang.String gameID)
      Unique constructor for TGame object. All you need to specify is a name that will help to identify this specific game. A brand new TGame object is in 'Initializing' state and all components needed to start a game MUST be created apart and specified using respective setter methods: a sacchetto, a list of gaming cards, a tabellone, a logger.
      Parameters:
      gameID - a name to identify this specific tombola match.

    • setSacchetto

      public void setSacchetto​(TSacchetto sacchetto)
      Set the sacchetto object (that is, the ballot box) to be used during the tombola game.  This method must be invoked only when the TGame object is in 'Initializing' status, that is before a match has been started (the first number has been extracted). Besides, the sacchetto object must be fresh new and contains all 90 numbers. When the sacchetto is set, the 'Tabellone' object for this game is also created or re-initialized.
      Parameters:
      sacchetto - A brand new sacchetto, still containing all 90 numbers to play.
      See Also:
      TSacchetto

    • getSacchetto

      public TSacchetto getSacchetto()
      Return the sacchetto object (the ballot box) associated to this game.
      Returns:
      the sacchetto object (the ballot box) associated to this game.
      See Also:
      TSacchetto

    • getTabellone

      public TCardList getTabellone()
      Return a list of card object containing the six "special" cards forming the tombola billboard associated to this game. The bill board is automatically created during the initialization phase, when a sacchetto object is set for the game.
      Returns:
      the list of six billboard cards associated to this game
      See Also:
      TBillboardCard.getWholeBillboard(String)

    • setLogger

      public void setLogger​(ILogger logger)
      Set the logger object that will be used during the game to spool all relevant messages regarding the status of the match. It MUSt be set during the initialization phase of the game and cannot be changed when the match is already started. See ILogger and TSimpleLogger to check all possibilities you have to catch tombola game messages or to define your custom logger to spool messages in the way you prefer.
      Parameters:
      logger - the logger object that will be used during the game to spool all relevant game messages

    • getLogger

      public ILogger getLogger()
      Return the ILogger interface implementing object associated to this game.
      Returns:
      the ILogger interface implementing object associated to this game.

    • setJollyOn

      public void setJollyOn​(boolean useJolly)
      Set the flag indicating is jolly numbers configured on cards must be considered when playing the game.
      Parameters:
      useJolly - true to let this TGame object consider the jolly numbers on card, false to ignore them (that is considering them as any other number on cards)

    • getJollyOn

      public boolean getJollyOn()
      Return true is jolly numbers are considered 'special' and highlighted in log messages during the game, false is they are ignored, that is considered as any other normal number on cards.
      Returns:
      is jolly numbers are considered 'special' or not.

    • setGamingCards

      public void setGamingCards​(TCardList cardList)
      Set the list containing all the cards that will be used during the tombola game.  TCardList objects can be prepared starting from TSeriesList objects, that are usually used to store and load series of cards to and from files.
      Parameters:
      cardList - the list containing all the cards that will be used during the tombola game.

      public long getElapsedTime()

      public long getGameStartTS()

      Returns:
      the 'system time' timestamp of the begin of the game

    • getGameEndTS

      Returns:
      the 'system time' timestamp of the end of the game

      Parameters:
      awards - the list of awards that will be used during the game.

      Returns:
      the complete list of award objects currently used by the game.

      Used to do statistical analysis on tombola matches. TODO(2.0) Update comments.
      Returns:
      an int matrix containing, at position [i][j] the number of conflicts for prize of value j at i-th extraction.

      public int getExtractionCount()
      Return the counter for extracted tombola number during the game. Its value is 0 (zero) if the game is not started jet, a positive value indicating how many numbers have already been extracted from eh ballot box.
      Returns:
      the current count of already extracted numbers from the ballot box.

    • extractNumber

      public TGameResultCode extractNumber()
      This method acts just like extractNumber(int) but does not require the extracted number as external input, providing automatically to extract a random number that has not already been extracted before.
      Returns:
      a TGameResultCode indicating the status of the game after the extraction and the next action to perform to properly continue the game.
      See Also:
      TTombolaExamples, TGameResultCode, TGameStatus

    • extractNumber

      public TGameResultCode extractNumber​(int number)
      You can consider this method as the "prince" of all TGame methods! It executes all the logic and controls to simulate and manage the consequences of the extraction of a number during a tombola game. It requires as an external input the number to be extracted (of course, it must be a valid number that has not been already extracted before) and checks all cards participating to the game against the available awards to verify if...
      1. there is a new award winner (for example, a card that get "TERNO")
      2. there two or more cards reaching the same award score, thus "contending it" and requiring a following resolveCandidates(int) or resolveCandidates(int[]) call
      3. there is a card winning the last available award, typically a Tombola, thus bringing the gate to its conclusion
      All relevant events are properly logged on the ILogger object set for the game.

      Finally, the methods return a TGameResultCode indicating the "consequences" of this extraction and therefore communicating to client code which is the correct next action to perform and continue appropriately the game.

      Please, find an example of the typical workflow needed to manage a complete Tombola match within the TTombolaExamples class.

      Parameters:
      number - the number just extracted: of course, it must be a valid number that has not been already extracted before.
      Returns:
      a TGameResultCode indicating the status of the game after the extraction and the next action to perform to properly continue the game.
      See Also:
      TTombolaExamples, TGameResultCode, TGameStatus

    • getFirstAwardToResolve

      public TAward getFirstAwardToResolve()
      When, during the tombola game, an award is contended by more than one card, that is, the game is paused in status "RESOLVING", this method returns the first award object within the ordered award list that have many contending cards.
      Returns:
      the first award object having more than one card contenting for it.
      See Also:
      TTombolaExamples

    • resolveCandidates

      public TGameResultCode resolveCandidates​(int winnerPos)
      This method is a syntactic sugar method and acts just like resolveCandidates(int[]), but allows to specify just a single, unique winner card for the first award that is in "CONTENDING" status. See the cited companion method for further details.
      Parameters:
      winnerPos - the index (i.e. the position) of the card you want to be the unique winner of the first award in "CONTENDED" status (see also getFirstAwardToResolve()).
      Returns:
      the status of the game object after the contention has been resolved, just like the status returned by a extractNumber(int) call. It is also possible that, after the resolution of a contention, the game still remains in "RESOLVING" status just because there are one or more loser that have been shifted to the next award (i.e. a "SECOND TERNO") and another call to resolveCandidates(...) is needed.
      See Also:
      resolveCandidates(int[]), TTombolaExamples

    • resolveCandidates

      public TGameResultCode resolveCandidates​(int[] winnerIndexes)
      When, after the extraction of a number, more than one card reach the score to be appointed to an available award, the game "pauses", enters the "RESOLVING" status and requires that someone, from the external, make a choice and resolves the conflicts. This method helps to manage this very common situation, letting the user to adopt whatever criteria she/he wants to take the choice and thus communicating it to the TGame object by means of this method.
      Parameters:
      winnerIndexes - a int[] vector containing the index/indexes (i.e. the positions) of the card/cards you want to be the unique winner or "ex equo" winners of the first award in "CONTENDED" status (see also getFirstAwardToResolve()).
      Returns:
      the status of the game object after the contention has been resolved, just like the status returned by a extractNumber(int) call. It is also possible that, after the resolution of a contention, the game still remains in "RESOLVING" status just because there are one or more loser that have been shifted to the next award (i.e. a "SECOND TERNO") and another call to resolveCandidates(...) is needed.

    • rollback

      public TGameResultCode rollback()
      This method, as you can imagine, allows the rollback of the last extracted number during a tombola game. Perhaps it requires to be checked, tested and fixed a bit...
      Returns:
      WRONG_NUMBER TGameResultCode value if the call to rollback() is invalid for some reason (no number has been already extracted, or the game is already ended or not in a proper status), NOWINNER is the rollback process "seems" to succeed.

    • getLastResultCode

      public TGameResultCode getLastResultCode()
      Return the resultCode reached by the last call to extractNumber(), extractNumber(int), resolveCandidates(int), resolveCandidates(int[]) or rollback() methods.
      Returns:
      the last resultCode reached by one of the Tombola Game actions methods.
